contentList:
Gunslinger ========= Main Class ========= Gunslinger DESCRIPTION Drifter Drifter DESCRIPTION Pistolero Pistolero DESCRIPTION Sniper Sniper DESCRIPTION Spellshot Spellshot DESCRIPTION Vanguard Vanguard DESCRIPTION Grit Grit DESCRIPTION Grit You gain 3 Grit points to spend on your gunslinger class features and 1 more at 4th and 8th level. You regain all expended Grit points at the end of a long rest. In addition, you regain 1 Grit point whenever you score a critical hit or a killing blow on an enemy. Dare Devil Daring acts in the most dire of situations are just what you need to get back into a fight. Starting at 7th level, when you have no more grit left, you may gain one of the following dares until you regain at least 1 grit. You may not choose a different dare until you have regained at least 1 grit. Desperate Evasion While this dare is active, you gain the evasion feature. If you already have this class feature, while this dare is active you have advantage in dexterity saving throws. You regain 1 grit point when you succeed two dexterity saving throws consecutively. Frantically Nimble While this dare is active, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. You regain 1 grit point when hostile creatures misses you with an attack three consecutive times. The attacks need not come from the same enemy. Out for Blood While this dare is active, reduce the number you need to roll to score a critical hit by 1. Run Like Hell While this dare is active, your speed increases by 10 feet, and you may take the dash action as a bonus action on your turn. you regain 1 grit point the moment you flee from combat. Vigilant Through your adventures, you’ve developed keen awareness and attention to detail even in the most limiting situations. Starting at level 8, Your passive perception can not be reduced as a result of having disadvantage. Stubborn You don’t like being told what to do, and you don’t give up on it. When you reach 13th level, when you fail a saving throw against charmed, frightened, or similar effects that would affect your actions, you can choose to succeed instead. Once you have used this feature, you may not use this feature again until the end of a long rest. Universal Armory PLACE HOLDER Shootist's Edge You make shots others find impossible. When a creature succeed in a saving throw or ability check against any of your gunslinger techniques, you may spend 1 grit point and force them to reroll the saving throw or ability check, protentially turning it into a failure. True Grit At 20th level, you may pick two techniques that you have that requires grit to perform. You may perform these techniques for 1 grit point fewer (minimum of 0) than usual. If the number of grit points to perform a deed is reduced to 0, you can perform the deed as long as you have at least 1 grit point left. If a technique could already be performed while you have at least 1 grit point left, you may perform that technique even when you have no grit points remaining.
Pistolero Technique Save DCs ========= Pistolero ========= You may choose to use charisma (intimidation) in place of dexterity to determine the DC of saving throws for your subclass features, in which case the DC is 8 + charimsa (intimidation). Raconteur's Reload The clicking sounds and the sight of you chambering another bullet stucks fear among your foes. At 1st level when you reload your firearm, you may spend 1 grit and cause all hostile creatures within 30ft of you to make a wisdom saving throw or be shakened until the start of your next turn. Ten Paces You react to trouble with lightning speed, positioning yourself just right. Starting at level 6, You may add your Chatisma modifier to your initiative rolls, and when you roll for initiative you may move up to 10 feet. Pistolero's Retort At level 10, when a creature within your short range critically fumbles in an attack roll, you may punish your foe’s failure with a shot. You may use your reaction to make an attack of opportunity with a one-handed firearm.
Blast Locks ========= 1st level Techniques ========= Sometimes taking the shortest distance between two points involves removing an obstacle or two. You may shoot your firearm at a lock within 5 feet as an action. Make an attack roll against the DC required to Pick the Lock. On hit, you open the lock without breaking its mechanisms. This has no effect if the lock is locked by magic such as the Arcane Lock spell. Cover Fire You may lay down suppressive fire to protect allies by forcing your foes to duck out of you way. When you make a ranged weapon attack with your firearm, you may choose to make cover fire instead. You must declare if you are using cover fire before you make the attack. If your attack hits, the target does not take damage but instead treat all target of its attacks until the start of your next turn to be under half cover.
